title: S&P 500 AI Workforce Mentions in Earnings Calls
description: Percentage of S&P 500 companies mentioning AI in the context of workforce efficiency, headcount, or restructuring during quarterly earnings calls.

overlays.label: Goldman: AI-mentioning firms have 3.2pp lower headcount growth
ACM: AI discussion intensity is leading deployment indicator

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2022 — AI Mentions
sources.excerpt: Only 8% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in Q4 2022 calls. Pre-ChatGPT baseline for corporate AI discussion.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2023 — AI Mentions Surge
sources.excerpt: AI mentions in S&P 500 earnings calls more than doubled to 18%. Companies began discussing AI efficiency gains and workforce implications.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q2 2023 — AI Dominates Calls
sources.excerpt: 32% of S&P 500 companies now discuss AI on earnings calls. 'AI' mentioned an average of 7 times per call among mentioning companies.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2023
sources.excerpt: AI mentions reached 36% of S&P 500 companies. Key themes: 'efficiency gains,' 'headcount optimization,' and 'AI-driven productivity.'

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2023
sources.excerpt: 40% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in context of workforce strategy. 'Year of Efficiency' framing adopted by 12% of companies.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2024
sources.excerpt: 43% mentioned AI-workforce topics. A new record. Companies increasingly cite specific headcount savings from AI deployments.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q2 2024
sources.excerpt: Slight dip to 41% as initial AI hype normalizes. Discussion shifting from aspirational to operational — specific ROI figures cited.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2024
sources.excerpt: 44% of S&P 500 discussed AI-workforce. Key new theme: 'AI-native' hiring replacing traditional roles in tech and professional services.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q4 2024
sources.excerpt: Record 48% of S&P 500 companies mentioned AI in workforce context. Average mentions per call reached 11. 'Restructuring' and 'automation' became top co-occurring terms.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q1 2025
sources.excerpt: 44% of S&P 500 discussed AI-workforce in Q1 2025, a slight pullback from Q4 2024's record. Discussion maturing: less hype, more specific deployment data.

sources.title: S&P 500 Earnings Call AI Analysis: Implications for Employment
sources.excerpt: Companies that mention AI + workforce on calls have average headcount growth 3.2pp lower than non-mentioners. The correlation has strengthened each quarter.

sources.title: FactSet Earnings Insight Q3 2025 — Record AI Mentions
sources.excerpt: Record 306 S&P 500 companies (61%) cited AI in Q3 2025 earnings calls — a new 10-year high, surpassing the prior record of 292. 95% of IT and Communications sectors mentioned AI. AI-citing companies outperformed 13.9% vs. 5.7%.

sources.title: Earnings calls citing 'AI' surge in 2025 as 'uncertainty' mentions fade
sources.excerpt: AI was the most-cited topic in S&P 500 earnings calls in 2025. Companies mentioning AI in workforce context outperformed peers by 8.2 percentage points on average.

sources.title: A Research Agenda for the Economics of Transformative AI
sources.publisher: CEPR / Stanford Digital Economy Lab (Brynjolfsson, Korinek, Agrawal)
sources.excerpt: As we approach Transformative AI, there is urgent need to advance understanding of how it reshapes economic models, institutions, and policies. Proposes nine Grand Challenges including economic growth, income distribution, and transition dynamics.
